comment: I took this class during spring of 2016. Professor Guragain was a very helpful professor. I went to his office several times for help and he helped with homeworks.
I took 2211 in spring of 2016. He was kind of tough teacher but helps the students a lot. A lot of office hours.
Lots of reading and know your calculations well he throws in lots of answers that seem right.

Professor Guragain was not a great professor. His style of teaching was reading off of the powerpoints that were from Webassign. Accent can be tough sometimes. An abundant amount of Webassign homework that counts as a test at the end, 4 tests, 1 is dropped, and the tests are hard. Tests are based off of recitations and book. Beware of taking him.

Prof. Guragain was an effective and fair teacher. Tests are hard but reasonable. There are only four tests, one is dropped, and HW counts as a test grade. He provides ample opportunities to help boost your grade. Web assigns are not easy, but help. His recitations are helpful. His tests are based off the book and recitations. Overall a fair teacher

Finds it completely acceptable to send crucial test information, of which he's known that we've been lacking for around two weeks, less than 24 hours from test time. Naturally, the average for that test was a 70: borderline failure. Has a bit of a language barrier, as many of the questions are oddly phrased.  Never admits when he's wrong.

Don't take. Dull, monotone and boring. does not know how to teach. reads directly from ppts and has a thick accent. Tests are MC and conceptual. crams in material in the last minute. Hw is webassign and there are 4 tests. Drops lowest test. No point in coming to class except for attendance which is taken randomly. Be prepared to read the book alot.
